biography.value:
Deprived of much of its magic as a special punishment, a deathlock wight lingers between the warlock it was and the wretched existence of a wight.

Deathlocks

The forging of a pact between a warlock and a patron is no minor occasion—at least not for the warlock. The consequences of breaking that pact can be dire and, in some cases, lethal. A warlock who fails to live up to a bargain with an evil patron runs the risk of rising from the dead as a deathlock, a foul Undead driven to serve its otherworldly patron.

An powerful necromancer might also discover the wicked methods of creating a deathlock and then subjugate it, acting as the deathlock’s patron.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

languages.custom: the languages it knew in life

description.value:
The deathlock makes two Life Drain or Grave Bolt attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=necrotic average=true]] damage. The target must succeed on a [[/save con 13 format=long]], or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

A &Reference[humanoid]{Humanoid} slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie (see the Monster Manual) under the deathlock’s control, unless the &Reference[humanoid]{Humanoid} is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The deathlock can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=necrotic average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using &Reference[cha]{Charisma} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13):

At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor

1/day each: fear, hold person

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Sunlight Sensitivity. While in sunlight, the deathlock has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Unusual &Reference[nat]{Nature}. The deathlock doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

You make yourself--including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings on your person--look different until the spell ends or until you use your action to dismiss it. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear thin, fat, or in between. You can't change your body type, so you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs. Otherwise, the extent of the &Reference[ill]{illusion} is up to you.

The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your outfit, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing or would feel your head and hair. If you use this spell to appear thinner than you are, the hand of someone who reaches out to touch you would bump into you while it was seemingly still in midair.

To discern that you are disguised, a creature can use its action to inspect your appearance and must succeed on an &Reference[int]{Intelligence} (&Reference[inv]{Investigation}) check against your spell save DC.

You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical &Reference[force]{force} surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

You project a phantasmal image of a creature’s worst fears. Each creature in a 30-foot &Reference[cone]{cone} must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for the duration.

While &Reference[frightened]{frightened} by this spell, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn’t have &Reference[line]{line} of sight to you, the creature can make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

materials.value: a white feather or the heart of a hen

description.value:
Choose a &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or be &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

materials.value: a small, straight piece of iron
